result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Pedro NMI Malpica
Current: 34 Lehner Street #c, Chilton, WI 53014 United States  (Effective: 07-18-2022)
Prior: 710 S Ashland Avenue, Apt #1, Green Bay, WI 54303 United States

948.025(1)(e) - Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child

Shall not have contact with A.J.C. (dob 5/17/2007) or any residence where she resides.  No contact means no contact in person, in writing, by phone, computer, through a third person or otherwise, except through the defendant's attorney.
Defendant may have one visit with officer to retrieve just basic belongings to get by while case is pending such as clothing and bathroom products.
No unsupervised contact with minors without parental supervision.

Advised of right to Preliminary Hearing,
Defendant waives said right,
Court finds probable cause,
Defendant bound over,
Information filed - waives reading,
Not guilty plea entered,
Bond amended
